title: Multi-Cloud Serverless Portfolio - Mirror Architecture
subtitle: AWS & Azure | Serverless | IaC | CI/CD
excerpt: Mirror Architecture deploying identical serverless portfolio across AWS and Azure with provider-native services
technologies: React 19, Vite, Python 3.12, AWS (S3, CloudFront, Lambda, DynamoDB, Route 53, ACM), Azure (Storage, Functions, CosmosDB), Cloudflare, Terraform, SAM/CloudFormation, GitHub Actions, Ansible
body_html:
Summary

A "Mirror Architecture" approach deploying a full-stack serverless portfolio in parallel across AWS and Azure. Demonstrates versatile cloud engineering by leveraging provider-native services for compute, database, and infrastructure management to achieve complete functional parity.

Technology Stack

Frontend: React 19, Vite, React Router 7, Bootstrap 4.5

Backend: Python 3.12, FastAPI (local), AWS Lambda, Azure Functions

Databases: DynamoDB (AWS), CosmosDB (Azure)

Infrastructure as Code: AWS SAM/CloudFormation, Terraform

DevOps: GitHub Actions, Ansible & Ansible Vault

Service Parity

| Function | AWS Stack | Azure Stack | |----------|-----------|-------------| | Static Hosting | S3 | Azure Storage | | CDN | CloudFront | Azure CDN & Cloudflare | | DNS | Route 53 | Cloudflare | | Serverless Compute | Lambda | Azure Functions | | NoSQL Database | DynamoDB | CosmosDB | | SSL/TLS | ACM | Cloudflare SSL |

AWS provides fully integrated first-party solutions, while Azure implementation strategically integrates Cloudflare for DNS, CDN, and SSL/TLS termination.

Key Features

  • Multi-Cloud Serverless Logic: Dynamic visitor counter with identical Python 3.12 business logic deployed across Lambda and Azure Functions, each interacting with respective NoSQL databases
  • Automated Lifecycle (CI/CD): Zero-touch deployments via GitHub Actions - provisions infrastructure via IaC and deploys React frontend to both cloud environments
  • End-to-End Security: SSL/TLS encryption enforced across both environments - AWS via ACM + CloudFront, Azure via Cloudflare SSL
  • Dual IaC Paradigms: AWS SAM/CloudFormation (provider-native) and Terraform (cloud-agnostic) showcasing proficiency in both approaches

Architecture

AWS Flow: Browser → Route 53 → CloudFront → S3 (React SPA) | API Gateway → Lambda → DynamoDB

Azure Flow: Browser → Cloudflare → Azure CDN → Azure Storage (React SPA) | Azure Functions → CosmosDB

Repository Composition

JavaScript: 46.6% | CSS: 21.3% | Python: 10.4% | HTML: 10.2% | HCL: 8.8% | Shell: 2.7%

title: Gen-AI RAG Contract Document Analyzer
subtitle: Generative AI | Document Analysis | NLP
excerpt: Intelligent contract document analysis system using RAG
technologies: Python, LangChain, NLTK, Vector DB, RAG, Document AI
body_html:
Summary

Built an intelligent contract document analysis system using RAG to extract key information, clauses, and obligations from legal documents.

Key Features

  • Document Processing: Automated extraction and indexing of contract terms
  • RAG Implementation: Context-aware question answering for contract analysis
  • NLP Features: Entity recognition, clause extraction, and semantic search
  • User Interface: Interactive query system for contract insights

Architecture

Document ingestion pipeline, RAG system with semantic search, interactive UI.

Challenges

Handling diverse document formats, ensuring extraction accuracy.

Key Learnings

Document processing, legal document understanding, RAG optimization.

title: Gen-AI RAG Corrosion Consultant ChatBot
subtitle: Generative AI | RAG | Machine Learning
excerpt: AI-powered corrosion consultant chatbot App using Retrieval-Augmented Generation
technologies: Python, LangChain, Huggingface, Vector DB, RAG, FastAPI
body_html:
Summary

Developed an AI-powered corrosion analysis platform using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture for intelligent document querying and technical insights.

Key Features

  • AI Architecture: RAG implementation with vector database for context-aware responses
  • ML Pipeline: LangChain integration for document processing and query handling
  • Domain Expertise: Specialized corrosion engineering knowledge base
  • API Development: RESTful endpoints for AI-powered analysis

Architecture

RAG system with vector embeddings, LLM for generation, API backend.

Challenges

Fine-tuning RAG for domain-specific accuracy, managing embeddings at scale.

Key Learnings

RAG architecture, vector databases, domain-specific AI applications.
